tagline: Cloud-native observability platform for metrics, logs, and distributed tracing at scale.
capabilities: High-cardinality metrics ingestion with cost-aware aggregation
End-to-end distributed tracing across services and regions
Log correlation with metrics and traces for rapid root-cause analysis
Latency and error budget monitoring aligned with SLOs
Change-aware alerting to reduce noise during deployments and scaling events

runbooks.title: Latency spike detected
steps: Confirm whether the spike coincides with a recent deployment or configuration change
Compare p50, p95, and p99 latency to identify tail amplification
Inspect upstream and downstream service dependencies for correlated slowdowns
Review recent autoscaling events and resource saturation indicators
If latency persists beyond 15 minutes, escalate to service owners

runbooks.title: Error rate increase
steps: Validate error classification (4xx vs 5xx) to scope ownership
Correlate error spikes with recent releases or traffic pattern changes
Inspect trace samples for common failure paths
Check dependency health for timeouts or throttling
Apply temporary alert dampening if caused by expected changes

runbooks.title: Metrics ingestion delay
steps: Confirm backlog growth in ingestion pipelines
Check regional collectors for CPU or memory saturation
Inspect network latency between agents and collectors
Validate retention and aggregation configuration for high-cardinality metrics
Escalate if ingest delay impacts SLO-based alerting

faqs.q: How does HelioCloud reduce alert fatigue?
faqs.a: HelioCloud incorporates temporal context, deployment awareness, and grace-period scoring to suppress short-lived noise while preserving visibility into sustained or correlated issues.

faqs.q: Does HelioCloud replace existing metrics or logging systems?
faqs.a: No. HelioCloud integrates with existing telemetry sources and collectors, acting as a unifying analysis and correlation layer rather than a replacement.

faqs.q: How does HelioCloud handle high-cardinality data?
faqs.a: HelioCloud applies adaptive aggregation, selective indexing, and cost-aware retention policies to balance query performance with observability fidelity.
